snippet: At an ashram in Punjab, followers of Ashutosh Maharaj insist that he is in a state of higher consciousness. A court disagrees, and has ordered his body cremated.
abstract: Nurmahal Journal; high court in India orders cremation of spiritual leader Ashutosh Maharaj, who was declared clinically dead of a heart attack in January 2014; his followers at ashram in Nurmahal swear he is alive inside secret chamber that contains his frozen body; insists he has attained higher level of consciousness and can control his heartbeat, state indistinguishable from death.
lead_paragraph: At an ashram in Punjab, followers of Ashutosh Maharaj insist that he is in a state of higher consciousness. A court disagrees, and has ordered his body cremated.

headline.main: Where a Holy Man Lies Frozen, Threat of a Standoff Looms
headline.print_headline: Where a Holy Man Lies Frozen, Threat of a Standoff Looms
